intro: Inversodicraea macrothyrsa, commonly known as the large-thorned evergreen, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its evergreen foliage, with dark green, leathery leaves that are elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
